tutorial.heroSubtitle: Connect Felicloud to any WebDAV-compatible application
tutorial.whatIsWebDAVDescription: WebDAV (Web Distributed Authoring and Versioning) is an extension of HTTP that allows you to connect Felicloud to virtually any application that supports file storage. This means you can access your files directly from file explorers, office applications, media players, and many other programs without using the Felicloud desktop app.
tutorial.noteText: Replace USERNAME with your actual Felicloud username (usually your email address).

windows.title: Windows
windows.step1: Open File Explorer and click on "This PC" in the left sidebar
windows.step2: Click on "Computer" tab in the ribbon, then "Map network drive"
windows.step4: Enter the WebDAV URL in the folder field
windows.step5: Check "Connect using different credentials" and click "Finish"
windows.step6: Enter your Felicloud email and password when prompted

macos.title: macOS
macos.step2: Press Command+K or Go ‚Üí Connect to Server from the menu
macos.step5: Choose "Registered User" and enter your credentials
macos.step6: Your Felicloud storage will appear in Finder

linux.title: Linux (GNOME/Nautilus)
linux.step2: Click "+ Other Locations" in the left sidebar
linux.step3: In "Connect to Server" at the bottom, enter the WebDAV URL starting with davs://
linux.step5: Enter your Felicloud credentials when prompted

commitment.title: Our Commitment to Your Privacy
commitment.content: At Felicloud, your privacy is our top priority. We are committed to protecting your personal data and being transparent about what information we collect and how we use it. This Privacy Policy explains our data practices and your rights under the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and other applicable data protection laws.

account.title: Account Information
account.intro: When you create a Felicloud account, we collect:
items: Your name and email address
Password (encrypted and never stored in plain text)
Account creation date and subscription plan details
Payment information (processed and stored securely by Stripe, not on our servers)

usage.title: Usage Data
usage.intro: We collect limited technical information to provide and improve our services:
items: IP address and device information (for security and authentication)
Browser type and operating system (for compatibility)
Storage usage statistics and file metadata (file names, sizes, modification dates)

files.title: Your Files and Content
files.content: Your files are encrypted and stored securely on our servers. We do not access, view, scan, or analyze the content of your files. File content is only accessible to you and anyone you explicitly choose to share with. File metadata (names, sizes, dates) is collected for service functionality but file contents remain private.

section2.title: 2. How We Use Your Information
section2.intro: We use your personal data only for the following purposes:
items: To provide, maintain, and improve Felicloud services
To process payments and manage your subscription
To communicate with you about your account, service updates, and support requests
To ensure security, prevent fraud, and protect against abuse
To comply with legal obligations and enforce our Terms of Service
section2.commitment: We do not use your data for advertising, marketing analytics, or any purpose not directly related to providing our services.

section3.title: 3. Data Storage and Security
section3.location: All your data is stored exclusively on servers located within the European Union. We use data centers with ISO 27001 certification and maintain strict physical and digital security measures.
section3.measures: We implement industry-standard security practices to protect your data:
items: End-to-end encryption for file transfers (TLS 1.3)
Encrypted storage using AES-256 encryption
Two-factor authentication options for enhanced account security
Regular security audits and penetration testing
Strict access controls and employee confidentiality agreements

section4.title: 4. Your Rights Under GDPR
section4.intro: As a user in the European Union, you have the following rights regarding your personal data:

access.title: Right to Access:
access.content: Request a copy of all personal data we hold about you

rectification.title: Right to Rectification:
rectification.content: Request correction of inaccurate or incomplete data

erasure.title: Right to Erasure:
erasure.content: Request deletion of your personal data and account

portability.title: Right to Data Portability:
portability.content: Request your data in a structured, machine-readable format

object.title: Right to Object:
object.content: Object to certain types of data processing

restrict.title: Right to Restrict Processing:
restrict.content: Request limitation of how we process your data

section4.contact: To exercise any of these rights, please contact our Data Protection Officer at privacy@felicloud.com. We will respond to your request within 30 days.

section5.title: 5. Data Sharing and Third Parties
section5.intro: We do not sell, rent, or trade your personal information to third parties. We only share data with trusted service providers who help us operate our services:
items: Stripe (payment processing) - processes payments securely and is PCI-DSS compliant
EU-based infrastructure providers (server hosting) - host our servers within the EU under strict data processing agreements
Email service providers (transactional emails only) - send account-related notifications

section6.title: 6. Cookies and Tracking
section6.intro: We use minimal cookies to provide essential functionality:
items: Authentication cookies (to keep you logged in)
Security cookies (to prevent fraud and protect your account)
section6.noTracking: We do not use tracking cookies, advertising cookies, or third-party analytics services. We do not track your behavior across websites or build user profiles for advertising purposes.

section7.title: 7. International Data Transfers
section7.intro: Your data is stored exclusively in the European Union and is not transferred outside the EU. In the rare case that we need to transfer data internationally, we ensure:
items: Transfers are only made to countries with adequate data protection (as determined by the European Commission)
Appropriate safeguards such as Standard Contractual Clauses are in place
section7.compliance: We are committed to maintaining GDPR compliance and European data protection standards at all times.

section8.title: 8. Data Retention
section8.content: We retain your personal data only for as long as necessary to provide our services and comply with legal obligations. Account data is retained while your account is active. Upon account deletion, we will delete your personal data and files within 30 days, except for data we are required to retain for legal, tax, or regulatory purposes (typically 7 years for billing records).

section9.title: 9. Children's Privacy
section9.content: Felicloud is not intended for children under 16 years of age. We do not knowingly collect personal information from children. If you believe we have inadvertently collected data from a child, please contact us immediately at privacy@felicloud.com, and we will delete such information promptly.

section10.title: 10. Contact Us
section10.intro: If you have any questions or concerns about this Privacy Policy or our data practices, please contact us:

gdpr.title: GDPR Compliance
gdpr.subtitle: Your Data Rights and Our Commitment to European Data Protection

intro.title: Introduction to GDPR
intro.content: The General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) is a comprehensive data protection law that came into effect on May 25, 2018. It establishes strict requirements for how organizations collect, process, store, and protect personal data of individuals in the European Union. At Felicloud, GDPR compliance is not just a legal obligation‚Äîit's a fundamental part of our commitment to protecting your privacy and respecting your rights.

section1.title: 1. Legal Basis for Data Processing
section1.intro: Under GDPR, we must have a lawful basis for processing your personal data. We process your data under the following legal grounds:

contract.title: Contractual Necessity:
contract.content: Processing your data is necessary to perform our contract with you (providing cloud storage services)

legitimate.title: Legitimate Interests:
legitimate.content: We have legitimate interests in ensuring security, preventing fraud, and improving our services

legal.title: Legal Obligation:
legal.content: We process certain data to comply with legal and regulatory requirements (e.g., tax laws, anti-money laundering)

consent.title: Consent:
consent.content: For optional features like marketing communications, we obtain your explicit consent

section2.title: 2. Data Minimization Principles
section2.intro: GDPR requires that we collect only the minimum amount of personal data necessary. In accordance with this principle:
items: We collect only essential information needed to provide our services
We do not track your browsing behavior or build advertising profiles
We do not share your data with third parties for marketing purposes
We automatically delete unnecessary data when it is no longer needed
section2.commitment: Our philosophy is simple: less data collected means less risk to your privacy.

section3.title: 3. Your GDPR Rights Explained
section3.intro: GDPR grants you comprehensive rights over your personal data. Here's what each right means in practice:

access.title: Right of Access (Article 15)
access.content: You can request a complete copy of all personal data we hold about you, including information about how we use it, who we share it with, and how long we keep it. We will provide this information in a clear, structured format within 30 days.

rectification.title: Right to Rectification (Article 16)
rectification.content: If any of your personal data is inaccurate or incomplete, you have the right to have it corrected. You can update most information directly in your account settings, or contact us for assistance.

erasure.title: Right to Erasure / 'Right to be Forgotten' (Article 17)
erasure.content: You can request deletion of your personal data. We will delete your account and all associated data within 30 days, except where we have a legal obligation to retain certain information (e.g., billing records for tax purposes).

portability.title: Right to Data Portability (Article 20)
portability.content: You can request your data in a commonly used, machine-readable format (such as JSON or CSV) so you can transfer it to another service provider. This includes your account information and file metadata.

object.title: Right to Object (Article 21)
object.content: You can object to certain types of data processing, particularly processing based on legitimate interests. For example, you can opt out of marketing communications at any time.

restrict.title: Right to Restrict Processing (Article 18)
restrict.content: In certain circumstances, you can request that we limit how we process your data while we investigate a concern or dispute you have raised.

section3.contact: To exercise any of these rights, please contact our Data Protection Officer at dpo@felicloud.com. We take all rights requests seriously and will respond promptly.

section4.title: 4. EU Data Residency
section4.intro: One of our core commitments is that all your data remains within the European Union. This provides you with the strongest data protection available worldwide.
section4.locations: Our servers are located in data centers within EU member states, specifically:
items: Primary data centers: France and Germany
Backup infrastructure: Netherlands and Finland
section4.cloudAct: By keeping all data within the EU, your information is protected from foreign surveillance laws such as the US CLOUD Act. Your data is subject exclusively to European jurisdiction and data protection standards.

section5.title: 5. Security Measures and Data Protection by Design
section5.intro: GDPR requires that we implement appropriate technical and organizational measures to protect your data. We employ multiple layers of security:
items: End-to-end encryption using industry-standard AES-256 encryption
Encrypted transmission of all data using TLS 1.3 protocol
Regular security audits and penetration testing by independent security firms
Strict access controls - only authorized personnel can access systems, and no one can access your file contents
Employee training on data protection and confidentiality
Incident response plan to address any potential data breaches within 72 hours as required by GDPR

section6.title: 6. Data Processing Agreements
section6.intro: When we use third-party service providers (known as 'data processors' under GDPR), we ensure they meet strict requirements:
items: All providers are located in the EU or have adequate data protection mechanisms
We have formal Data Processing Agreements (DPAs) in place with all processors
Processors are contractually required to implement appropriate security measures and only process data according to our instructions
section6.encryption: We carefully vet all service providers to ensure they maintain GDPR compliance and uphold the same high standards for data protection that we do.

section7.title: 7. International Data Transfers (None)
section7.intro: Unlike many cloud providers, we do not transfer your data outside the European Union. However, for transparency, we explain what safeguards would be required if such transfers were necessary:
items: Standard Contractual Clauses (SCCs) approved by the European Commission
Adequacy decisions confirming the recipient country provides adequate data protection
section7.agreements: Our commitment is to avoid international transfers altogether by maintaining all infrastructure within the EU, giving you the highest level of protection.

section8.title: 8. Supervisory Authority and Complaints
section8.intro: You have the right to lodge a complaint with a data protection supervisory authority if you believe we have violated your GDPR rights. The supervisory authority in your country is responsible for handling such complaints.
section8.link: You can find your local data protection authority at:
section8.linkText: European Data Protection Board - Members List

section9.title: 9. Data Protection Officer
section9.intro: We have appointed a Data Protection Officer (DPO) to oversee our GDPR compliance and handle data protection matters. You can contact our DPO directly with any questions or concerns:

section10.title: 10. Transparency and Accountability
section10.intro: GDPR requires organizations to demonstrate compliance through documentation and transparency. We maintain:
items: Records of all data processing activities
Data Protection Impact Assessments (DPIAs) for high-risk processing
Regular internal audits of data protection practices
This public GDPR compliance statement outlining our commitments and practices

questions.title: Questions About GDPR?
questions.intro: We're committed to transparency and helping you understand your data protection rights. If you have any questions about GDPR, our compliance practices, or how we protect your data, please don't hesitate to reach out.
questions.response: We will respond to all inquiries within 48 hours and handle rights requests within the GDPR-mandated 30-day timeframe.

section1.title: 1. Ownership of Content
section1.content: You retain full ownership and all intellectual property rights to any content, files, documents, photos, videos, and other materials you upload to Felicloud. By using our services, you do not transfer any ownership rights to us. We claim no intellectual property rights over the content you create, store, or share through our platform. Your content is yours, and it remains yours.

section2.title: 2. Felicloud Intellectual Property
section2.intro: The Felicloud platform, including its software, website design, branding, logos, and documentation, is protected by intellectual property laws. The following elements are owned by or licensed to Felicloud:
items: The Felicloud name, logo, and branding materials
Website design, layout, and user interface elements
Marketing materials, documentation, and support content
Custom software code and proprietary features we develop
Service infrastructure and architecture (excluding the Nextcloud open-source components)
All trademarks, service marks, and trade names associated with Felicloud

section3.title: 3. Open Source Components
section3.intro: Felicloud is built on Nextcloud, an open-source platform licensed under the GNU Affero General Public License (AGPL). We respect and comply with all open-source licenses. Specifically:
items: The Nextcloud software remains open source and is licensed under AGPL v3
Any modifications we make to Nextcloud core code are made available in compliance with AGPL
We contribute back to the Nextcloud community where appropriate
Users have the same rights to Nextcloud software as granted by the AGPL license
Our proprietary additions and custom integrations are separate from the open-source core

section4.title: 4. License to Use Our Services
section4.content: Subject to your compliance with these Terms of Service, we grant you a limited, non-exclusive, non-transferable, revocable license to access and use Felicloud services for your personal or business purposes. This license does not include the right to resell our services, copy our software or branding, or use our platform to provide similar services to third parties without our written permission.

section5.title: 5. Copyright Infringement and DMCA
section5.content: Felicloud respects the intellectual property rights of others and expects our users to do the same. We do not monitor the content of user files due to our encryption and privacy commitments. However, if you believe that content accessible through Felicloud infringes your copyright, you may submit a notice in accordance with the Digital Millennium Copyright Act (DMCA) or equivalent European copyright laws. Upon receiving a valid notice, we will investigate and take appropriate action, which may include removing the allegedly infringing content and/or suspending the account of the user who uploaded it.

section6.title: 6. Submitting a Copyright Complaint
section6.intro: If you believe your copyrighted work has been infringed, please provide our legal team with the following information:
section6.subject: Subject: Copyright Infringement Notice - DMCA

section7.title: 7. Counter-Notification
section7.content: If you believe that content you uploaded was removed or disabled due to a mistake or misidentification, you may submit a counter-notification to our legal team. Upon receiving a valid counter-notification, we will forward it to the party who submitted the original complaint and may restore the content unless the complainant files a legal action seeking a court order.

section8.title: 8. Trademark Policy
section8.content: The Felicloud name and logo are trademarks of Felicloud. You may not use our trademarks without our prior written consent. This includes using our name or logo in a way that could cause confusion about the source of products or services, or in a manner that disparages or discredits Felicloud.

section9.title: 9. User-Generated Content and Sharing
section9.content: When you share files or folders with other users through Felicloud's sharing features, you grant those users permission to access and use the shared content according to the permissions you set (view-only, download, edit, etc.). You are responsible for ensuring you have the right to share any content and that sharing does not violate any third-party intellectual property rights.
